trans-unit.source: A configuration element that controls the discovery functionality of an endpoint.

When added to endpointâ€™s behavior configuration, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.Configuration.EndpointDiscoveryElement> element allows the discovery functionality of the endpoint to be enabled or disabled.
Additionally it allows specifying custom scope URIs that can be used to filter service endpoints during discovery operations.
It also allows specifying custom XML metadata that is published along with the standard discoverable metadata.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.Configuration.EndpointDiscoveryElement> is dependent on the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.Configuration.ServiceDiscoveryElement> that provides service level control of discoverability.

This means that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.Configuration.EndpointDiscoveryElement> and its settings are ignored if a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.Configuration.ServiceDiscoveryElement> element is not present.
The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.Configuration.EndpointDiscoveryElement> element and add two scope elements.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.Configuration.EndpointDiscoveryElement"></xref> class.
Gets the behavior type associated with the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.Configuration.EndpointDiscoveryElement"></xref>.
Gets the contract type names associated with the endpoint.
The contract type names associated with the endpoint.
Gets or sets a value that indicates the discoverability of this endpoint.
`true` if the discoverability of this endpoint is enabled, otherwise `false`.
Gets the extensions associated with the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.Configuration.EndpointDiscoveryElement"></xref>.
Gets a collection of scopes for this endpoint.
A scope is any URI that can be used to group services into logical groups.
A collection of scopes associated with this endpoint.
